node.title: Man swapped at birth resented mum for not switching them back
node.description: The switch left him growing up in a less fortunate position than the other child.
node.content: ["A man swapped at birth in South Africa said he wouldn't wish it on his worst enemy after he grew up in a less fortunate position than the other child.", "Robin and Gavin were accidentally given to the wrong mothers by a nurse at Nigel Hospital in Johannesburg in February 1989, the Mirror reported. They were the only babies born at the hospital that day and the tags were switched.", "The mix-up left Robin to be raised by single mother Sandy Dawkins, who was struggling to get by in Johannesburg, while Gavin grew up with wealthier parent Meg Clinton Parker in Pietermaritzburg, the Mirror reported.", "Two years later, the mistake was uncovered when a paternity dispute over Gavin's rightful father led to a DNA test revealing Parker was not his birth mother.\u00a0", "Dawkins told 60 Minutes Australia when she found out, she went \"hysterical immediately\".", "\"Initially I think you protect the one you've got... the first few days are shock, then the curiosity comes. Wheres my baby?\" Parker told the programme.", "The mothers decided not to switch the babies back.", "Robin said when he was 15, he had difficulty accepting the situation and resented his mother for not swapping them back. He said he has had to work hard for everything, while Gavin \"gets it easy\".", "Now Robin, 32, understands why the mothers chose not to switch the babies back after having his own son.", "\"If I was to find out he wasn't mine, there's no way I'd give him back,\" he said. \"I would make the decision that I\u2019m not getting to know the other child because what I\u2019ve got is good, and keep it that way.\""]
